item.title: Scientists find the genetic clues that let humans walk on two legs
item.description: Two small changes in human DNA may have played a big role in helping our ancestors walk upright, researchers say.

item.title: Study finds surprising link between gut and brain rhythms
item.description: The human body is packed with natural rhythms, from your sleep-wake cycle to the steady pulsing of blood through the brain to heart rate and pulse.
